question: 年頃
userAnswer: age-range/age | that-age/adolescence/puberty | {approximate | marriageable | sufficient}-age | age-of-adulthood | past-few-years
activeAnswer: age-range/age | that-age/adolescence/puberty | {approximate | marriageable | sufficient}-age | age-of-adulthood | past-few-years
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>year</kanji> <kanji>approximate</kanji> is your <vocabulary>approximate age</vocabulary>. This is also an indirect way to refer to <vocabulary>adolescence</vocabulary>, and when people reach <vocabulary>marriageable age</vocabulary>!
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the reading of the vocab version of <ja>年</ja> plus <ja>頃</ja>, put together. Note: You will also sometimes see this written partially in kana like <ja>年ごろ</ja>.
